name: Order me!
description:
Made for Valentine's VN Jam 2021.

What happens after Valentine's Day?

Gabriel is one of the most successful pop stars in his country, Neo-Paradise: the idol of many teenagers. Yet, here is the thing: he is longing to go back to singing more operatic songs, considering he is a classical-trained countertenor. What prevents him from stopping his career, you may ask? Seiji, his scene partner, with whom he is deeply in love (although he won’t admit it): he doesn’t want to abandon him. With Valentine’s Day approaching, will Gabriel be able to confess all his feelings to him? And what will happen after Valentine’s Day?
To discover it, play this heartfelt and absolutely not plot-twisty game!

Characters

And here is our demo dreamcast!

Okay, but what is concretely there in this game?

Fine, fine, next time, I won’t bother doing a summary! So what you can expect from the game, at its demo state, is:

— around 1h30 of content (more if you’re a slow-reader!)
— the possibility to seduce Seiji (but you might seduce the other guys and more after the demo!)
— absolutely not irritating but instead deeply endearing characters; especially, the most kawaii character you’ve ever met
— hazardous jokes attempt
— even more hazardous art attempt
— the most well-written and passionate yet not totally NSFW erotic scenes you’ve ever read (maybe I’m lying, maybe not... You’ll have to find the truth yourself...)

And... who are you?

Oh, you know, a nobody, just someone enjoying writing stories that break my soul and hopefully yours. But if you’re really into indie BL visual novels, maybe you know La Vie en Rose, from the very great Abyss Team. I was lead writer on it! You might also know me from my Professor Layton fanfiction from 2010 but hopefully not.

Credits

Writing — A proud Yacine Aggoune!
Art, GUI — ... erm... who knows? Hehe it would suck to be them, right? Hehehe
Music — Original tracks by Guillaume Laurent. Placeholder tracks from Audionautix and Bensound.
Sound effects — From Zapsplat.
